newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's main crude ports remain closed.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's main crude ports remain closed.

text.p: Mexico's three main crude oil ports remained closed on Sunday because of high winds and choppy seas, the Communications and Transport Ministry said on Sunday.
The Gulf of Mexico ports of Cayo Arcas, Dos Bocas and Coatzacoalcos were closed because of a cold front had created unsafe sailing conditions, the ministry said.
Dos Bocas had the worst conditions with winds from 55 to 60 kph (34 to 37 mph) and waves of 12 to 14 feet (3.6 to 4.2 meters).
The ports of Ciudad del Carmen, Campeche and Progreso on the west coast of the Yucatan Peninsula also were closed on Sunday, the report said.
